paper_title.en: The unification problem for confluent right-ground term rewriting systems

description.en: The unification problem for term rewriting systems (TRSs) is the problem of deciding, for a given TRS R and two terms M and N, whether there exists a substitution theta such that Mtheta and Ntheta are congruent modulo R (i.e., Mtheta <----> (R) Ntheta). In this paper, the unification problem for confluent right-ground TRSs is shown to be decidable. To show this, the notion of minimal terms is introduced and a new unification algorithm for obtaining a substitution whose range consists of minimal terms is proposed. Our result extends the decidability of unification for canonical (i.e., terminating and confluent) right-ground TRSs given by Hullot [Proceedings of the 5th Conference on Automated Deduction, LNCS, vol. 87, 1980, p. 318] in the sense that the termination condition can be omitted. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science (USA). All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: The unification problem for confluent right-ground term rewriting systems

description.en: The unification problem for term rewriting systems (TRSs) is the problem of deciding, for a given TRS R and two terms M and N, whether there exists a substitution theta such that Mtheta and Ntheta are congruent modulo R (i.e., Mtheta <----> (R) Ntheta). In this paper, the unification problem for confluent right-ground TRSs is shown to be decidable. To show this, the notion of minimal terms is introduced and a new unification algorithm for obtaining a substitution whose range consists of minimal terms is proposed. Our result extends the decidability of unification for canonical (i.e., terminating and confluent) right-ground TRSs given by Hullot [Proceedings of the 5th Conference on Automated Deduction, LNCS, vol. 87, 1980, p. 318] in the sense that the termination condition can be omitted. paper_title.en: On the Church-Rosser property of left-linear term rewriting systems

description.en: G. Huet (1980) showed that a left-linear term-rewriting system (TRS) is Church-Rosser (CR) if P negated right arrow Q for every critical pair < P, Q > where P negated right arrow Q is a parallel reduction from P to Q. This paper shows that Huet's result can be generalized under the assumption that a subsystem K of TRS R (i.e., K subset of or equal to R) is CR. That is, we show that R is CR if P negated right arrow (K) Q for every < P, Q > is an element of CP(K, R-K) and P negated right arrow (R-K) . --> (*)(K) . <-- (*)(K) Q for every < P, Q > is an element of CP(R-K, R). Here, CP (R-1, R-2) is the set of critical pairs obtained from some rule of R1 and one Of R2.

publication_name.en: IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON INFORMATION AND SYSTEMS

paper_title.en: On the Church-Rosser property of left-linear term rewriting systems

description.en: G. Huet (1980) showed that a left-linear term-rewriting system (TRS) is Church-Rosser (CR) if P negated right arrow Q for every critical pair < P, Q > where P negated right arrow Q is a parallel reduction from P to Q. This paper shows that Huet's result can be generalized under the assumption that a subsystem K of TRS R (i.e., K subset of or equal to R) is CR. That is, we show that R is CR if P negated right arrow (K) Q for every < P, Q > is an element of CP(K, R-K) and P negated right arrow (R-K) . --> (*)(K) . <-- (*)(K) Q for every < P, Q > is an element of CP(R-K, R). Here, CP (R-1, R-2) is the set of critical pairs obtained from some rule of R1 and one Of R2.

paper_title.ja: 非線形TRSのE重なり性について
paper_title.en: On the E-Overlapping Property of Nonlinear Term Rewriting Systems

description.ja: 項書換えシステム（TRS）の重要な性質の一つに合流性があり，最近，非線形TRSにおいては非E重なり性がその合流性と密接に関係していることが報告された．しかし，非E重なり性は一般に非可解な問題である．本論文では，まず「深さ保存」の概念を導入し，TRSが深さ保存的であるとき，非ω重なりならば非E重なりであることを示す．非ω重なり性は判定可能な性質であることから，この結果を用いて，合流性を保証する判定可能な十分条件をいくつか導くことができることを示す．次に，右定項TRSのクラスに限定すれば非E重なり性判定問題が可解であることを明らかにする．

paper_title.ja: On the Church-Rosser Property of Non-E-overlapping and Strongly Depth-preserving Term Rewriting Systems
paper_title.en: On the Church - Rosser Property of Non -E- overlapping and Strongly Depth - preserving Term Rewriting Systems

description.ja: A term rewriting system (TRS) is said to be depth-preserving if for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the both sides the maximal depth of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side is greater than or equal to that of the variable occurrences in the right-hand-side and to be strongly depth-preserving if it is depth-preserving and for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the left-hand-side all the depths of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side are the same. This paper shows that there exit non-E-overlapping and depth-preserving TRS's which are not Church-Rosser but all the non-E-overlapping and strongly depth-preserving TRS's are Church-Rosser.A term rewriting system (TRS) is said to be depth-preserving if for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the both sides, the maximal depth of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side is greater than or equal to that of the variable occurrences in the right-hand-side, and to be strongly depth-preserving if it is depth-preserving and for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the left-hand-side, all the depths of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side are the same. This paper shows that there exit non-E-overlapping and depth-preserving TRS's which are not Church-Rosser, but all the non-E-overlapping and strongly depth-preserving TRS's are Church-Rosser.
description.en: A term rewriting system (TRS) is said to be depth-preserving if for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the both sides, the maximal depth of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side is greater than or equal to that of the variable occurrences in the right-hand-side, and to be strongly depth-preserving if it is depth-preserving and for any rewrite rule and any variable appearing in the left-hand-side, all the depths of the variable occurrences in the left-hand-side are the same. This paper shows that there exit non-E-overlapping and depth-preserving TRS's which are not Church-Rosser, but all the non-E-overlapping and strongly depth-preserving TRS's are Church-Rosser.
